intro: Erigeron brachyspermus, commonly known as the narrowhead fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs. The species is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant plant.
